meanings.definition: A person employed to drive a private or hired car.
meanings.sent1: The chauffeur drove the family to the airport.
meanings.sent2: The wealthy businessman hired a chauffeur to drive him around the city.
meanings.sent3: The chauffeur accidentally took the wrong turn and ended up at the zoo instead of the museum.
meanings.sent4: She navigated the busy streets like a skilled chauffeur, smoothly guiding the car through traffic.
meanings.sent5: The chauffeur's uniform was crisp and professional, making him easily recognizable.

meanings.definition: To drive a car as a chauffeur.
meanings.sent1: He will chauffeur the guests to the wedding venue in style.
meanings.sent2: She chauffeured her friends to the concert in her new car.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to chauffeur the toy mouse around the room, pretending it was a real car.
meanings.sent4: The music chauffeured her thoughts to a peaceful place, calming her mind.
meanings.sent5: The wind seemed to chauffeur the leaves across the yard, creating a mesmerizing dance.
